body:
FWIW, I have never used those clean scripts.

To clean a $GOROOT, git clean is always better,
unless it's a release source tarball, but in that case,
just delete it and re-extract the tarball is safer.

I suspect the reason we have such scripts is because
hg doesn't provide a cleanup command by default
(there is a purge standard extension though) and
we used to put intermediate build files into package
source directory.
